00020   using namespace std;

00022   const string DMS::hemispheres_ = "SNWE";
00023   const string DMS::signs_ = "-+";
00024   const string DMS::digits_ = "0123456789";
00025   const string DMS::dmsindicators_ = "D'\"";
00026   const string DMS::components_[] = {"degrees", "minutes", "seconds"};
00027 
00028   Math::real DMS::Decode(const std::string& dms, flag& ind) {
00029     string errormsg;
00030     do {                       // Executed once (provides the ability to break)
00031       int sign = 1;
00032       unsigned
00033         beg = 0,
00034         end = unsigned(dms.size());
00035       while (beg < end && isspace(dms[beg]))
00036         ++beg;
00037       while (beg < end && isspace(dms[end - 1]))
00038         --end;
00039       flag ind1 = NONE;
00040       int k = -1;
00041       if (end > beg && (k = lookup(hemispheres_, dms[beg])) >= 0) {
00042         ind1 = (k / 2) ? LONGITUDE : LATITUDE;
00043         sign = k % 2 ? 1 : -1;
00044         ++beg;
00045       }
00046       if (end > beg && (k = lookup(hemispheres_, dms[end-1])) >= 0) {
00047         if (k >= 0) {
00048           if (ind1 != NONE) {
00049             if (toupper(dms[beg - 1]) == toupper(dms[end - 1]))
00050               errormsg = "Repeated hemisphere indicators " + str(dms[beg - 1])
00051                 + " in " + dms.substr(beg - 1, end - beg + 1);
00052             else
00053               errormsg = "Contradictory hemisphere indicators "
00054                 + str(dms[beg - 1]) + " and " + str(dms[end - 1]) + " in "
00055                 + dms.substr(beg - 1, end - beg + 1);
00056             break;
00057           }
00058           ind1 = (k / 2) ? LONGITUDE : LATITUDE;
00059           sign = k % 2 ? 1 : -1;
00060           --end;
00061         }
00062       }
00063       if (end > beg && (k = lookup(signs_, dms[beg])) >= 0) {
00064         if (k >= 0) {
00065           sign *= k ? 1 : -1;
00066           ++beg;
00067         }
00068       }
00069       if (end == beg) {
00070         errormsg = "Empty or incomplete DMS string " + dms;
00071         break;
00072       }
00073       real ipieces[] = {0, 0, 0};
00074       real fpieces[] = {0, 0, 0};
00075       unsigned npiece = 0;
00076       real icurrent = 0;
00077       real fcurrent = 0;
00078       unsigned ncurrent = 0, p = beg;
00079       bool pointseen = false;
00080       unsigned digcount = 0;
00081       while (p < end) {
00082         char x = dms[p++];
00083         if ((k = lookup(digits_, x)) >= 0) {
00084           ++ncurrent;
00085           if (digcount > 0)
00086             ++digcount;           // Count of decimal digits_
00087           else
00088             icurrent = 10 * icurrent + k;
00089         } else if (x == '.') {
00090           if (pointseen) {
00091             errormsg = "Multiple decimal points in "
00092               + dms.substr(beg, end - beg);
00093             break;
00094           }
00095           pointseen = true;
00096           digcount = 1;
00097         } else if ((k = lookup(dmsindicators_, x)) >= 0) {
00098           if (unsigned(k) == npiece - 1) {
00099             errormsg = "Repeated " + components_[k] +
00100               " component in " + dms.substr(beg, end - beg);
00101             break;
00102           } else if (unsigned(k) < npiece) {
00103             errormsg = components_[k] + " component follows "
00104               + components_[npiece - 1] + " component in "
00105               + dms.substr(beg, end - beg);
00106             break;
00107           }
00108           if (ncurrent == 0) {
00109             errormsg = "Missing numbers in " + components_[k] +
00110               " component of " + dms.substr(beg, end - beg);
00111             break;
00112           }
00113           if (digcount > 1) {
00114             istringstream s(dms.substr(p - digcount - 1, digcount));
00115             s >> fcurrent;
00116           }
00117           ipieces[k] = icurrent;
00118           fpieces[k] = icurrent + fcurrent;
00119           if (p < end) {
00120             npiece = k + 1;
00121             icurrent = fcurrent = 0;
00122             ncurrent = digcount = 0;
00123           }
00124         } else if (lookup(signs_, x) >= 0) {
00125           errormsg = "Internal sign in DMS string "
00126             + dms.substr(beg, end - beg);
00127           break;
00128         } else {
00129           errormsg = "Illegal character " + str(x) + " in DMS string "
00130             + dms.substr(beg, end - beg);
00131           break;
00132         }
00133       }
00134       if (!errormsg.empty())
00135         break;
00136       if (lookup(dmsindicators_, dms[p - 1]) < 0) {
00137         if (npiece >= 3) {
00138           errormsg = "Extra text following seconds in DMS string "
00139             + dms.substr(beg, end - beg);
00140           break;
00141         }
00142         if (ncurrent == 0) {
00143           errormsg = "Missing numbers in trailing component of "
00144             + dms.substr(beg, end - beg);
00145           break;
00146         }
00147         if (digcount > 1) {
00148           istringstream s(dms.substr(p - digcount, digcount));
00149           s >> fcurrent;
00150         }
00151         ipieces[npiece] = icurrent;
00152         fpieces[npiece] = icurrent + fcurrent;
00153       }
00154       if (pointseen && digcount == 0) {
00155         errormsg = "Decimal point in non-terminal component of "
00156           + dms.substr(beg, end - beg);
00157         break;
00158       }
00159       // Note that we accept 59.999999... even though it rounds to 60.
00160       if (ipieces[1] >= 60) {
00161         errormsg = "Minutes " + str(fpieces[1]) + " not in range [0, 60)";
00162         break;
00163       }
00164       if (ipieces[2] >= 60) {
00165         errormsg = "Seconds " + str(fpieces[2]) + " not in range [0, 60)";
00166         break;
00167       }
00168       ind = ind1;
00169       // Assume check on range of result is made by calling routine (which
00170       // might be able to offer a better diagnostic).
00171       return real(sign) * (fpieces[0] + (fpieces[1] + fpieces[2] / 60) / 60);
00172     } while (false);
00173     real val = NumMatch(dms);
00174     if (val == 0)
00175       throw GeographicErr(errormsg);
00176     else
00177       ind = NONE;
00178     return val;
00179   }
00180 
00181   Math::real DMS::NumMatch(const std::string& s) {
00182     if (s.length() < 3)
00183       return 0;
00184     string t;
00185     t.resize(s.length());
00186     for (size_t i = s.length(); i--;)
00187       t[i] = toupper(s[i]);
00188     int sign = t[0] == '-' ? -1 : 1;
00189     string::size_type p0 = t[0] == '-' || t[0] == '+' ? 1 : 0;
00190     string::size_type p1 = t.find_last_not_of('0');
00191     if (p1 == string::npos || p1 + 1 < p0 + 3)
00192       return 0;
00193     // Strip off sign and trailing 0s
00194     t = t.substr(p0, p1 + 1 - p0);  // Length at least 3
00195     if (t == "NAN" || t == "1.#QNAN" || t == "1.#SNAN" || t == "1.#IND")
00196       return sign * Math::NaN();
00197     else if (t == "INF" || t == "1.#INF")
00198       return sign * Math::infinity();
00199     return 0;
00200   }
00201 
00202   Math::real DMS::Decode(const std::string& str) {
00203     istringstream is(str);
00204     string errormsg;
00205     real num;
00206     do {                       // Executed once (provides the ability to break)
00207       if (!(is >> num)) {
00208         errormsg = "Could not read number: " + str;
00209         break;
00210       }
00211       // On some platforms, is >> num gobbles final E in 1234E, so look for
00212       // last character which is legal as the final character in a number
00213       // (digit or period).
00214       int pos = min(int(is.tellg()), int(str.find_last_of("0123456789.")) + 1);
00215       if (pos != int(str.size())) {
00216         errormsg = "Extra text " + str.substr(pos) + " in number " + str;
00217         break;
00218       }
00219       return num;
00220     } while (false);
00221     num = NumMatch(str);
00222     if (num == 0)
00223       throw GeographicErr(errormsg);
00224     return num;
00225   }
00226 
00227   void DMS::DecodeLatLon(const std::string& stra, const std::string& strb,
00228                          real& lat, real& lon) {
00229       real a, b;
00230       flag ia, ib;
00231       a = Decode(stra, ia);
00232       b = Decode(strb, ib);
00233       if (ia == NONE && ib == NONE) {
00234         // Default to lat, long
00235         ia = LATITUDE;
00236         ib = LONGITUDE;
00237       } else if (ia == NONE)
00238         ia = flag(LATITUDE + LONGITUDE - ib);
00239       else if (ib == NONE)
00240         ib = flag(LATITUDE + LONGITUDE - ia);
00241       if (ia == ib)
00242         throw GeographicErr("Both " + stra + " and "
00243                             + strb + " interpreted as "
00244                             + (ia == LATITUDE ? "latitudes" : "longitudes"));
00245       real
00246         lat1 = ia == LATITUDE ? a : b,
00247         lon1 = ia == LATITUDE ? b : a;
00248       if (lat1 < -90 || lat1 > 90)
00249         throw GeographicErr("Latitude " + str(lat1) + "d not in [-90d, 90d]");
00250       if (lon1 < -180 || lon1 > 360)
00251         throw GeographicErr("Latitude " + str(lon1)
00252                             + "d not in [-180d, 360d]");
00253       if (lon1 >= 180)
00254         lon1 -= 360;
00255       lat = lat1;
00256       lon = lon1;
00257   }
00258 
00259   Math::real DMS::DecodeAngle(const std::string& angstr) {
00260     DMS::flag ind;
00261     real ang = Decode(angstr, ind);
00262     if (ind != DMS::NONE)
00263       throw GeographicErr("Arc angle " + angstr
00264                           + " includes a hemisphere, N/E/W/S");
00265     return ang;
00266   }
00267 
00268   Math::real DMS::DecodeAzimuth(const std::string& azistr) {
00269     DMS::flag ind;
00270     real azi = Decode(azistr, ind);
00271     if (ind == DMS::LATITUDE)
00272       throw GeographicErr("Azimuth " + azistr
00273                           + " has a latitude hemisphere, N/S");
00274     if (azi < -180 || azi > 360)
00275       throw GeographicErr("Azimuth " + azistr + " not in range [-180d,360d]");
00276     if (azi >= 180) azi -= 360;
00277     return azi;
00278   }
00279 
00280   string DMS::Encode(real angle, component trailing, unsigned prec, flag ind) {
00281     // Assume check on range of input angle has been made by calling
00282     // routine (which might be able to offer a better diagnostic).
00283     if (!Math::isfinite(angle))
00284       return angle < 0 ? string("-inf") :
00285         (angle > 0 ? string("inf") : string("nan"));
00286 
00287     // 15 - 2 * trailing = ceiling(log10(2^53/90/60^trailing)).
00288     // This suffices to give full real precision for numbers in [-90,90]
00289     prec = min(15 - 2 * unsigned(trailing), prec);
00290     real scale = 1;
00291     for (unsigned i = 0; i < unsigned(trailing); ++i)
00292       scale *= 60;
00293     for (unsigned i = 0; i < prec; ++i)
00294       scale *= 10;
00295     if (ind == AZIMUTH)
00296       angle -= floor(angle/360) * 360;
00297     int sign = angle < 0 ? -1 : 1;
00298     angle *= sign;
00299 
00300     // Break off integer part to preserve precision in manipulation of
00301     // fractional part.
00302     real
00303       idegree = floor(angle),
00304       fdegree = floor((angle - idegree) * scale + real(0.5)) / scale;
00305     if (fdegree >= 1) {
00306       idegree += 1;
00307       fdegree -= 1;
00308     }
00309     real pieces[3] = {fdegree, 0, 0};
00310     for (unsigned i = 1; i <= unsigned(trailing); ++i) {
00311       real
00312         ip = floor(pieces[i - 1]),
00313         fp = pieces[i - 1] - ip;
00314       pieces[i] = fp * 60;
00315       pieces[i - 1] = ip;
00316     }
00317     pieces[0] += idegree;
00318     ostringstream s;
00319     s << fixed  << setfill('0');
00320     if (ind == NONE && sign < 0)
00321       s << '-';
00322     switch (trailing) {
00323     case DEGREE:
00324       if (ind != NONE)
00325         s << setw(1 + min(int(ind), 2) + prec + (prec ? 1 : 0));
00326       s << setprecision(prec) << pieces[0];
00327       // Don't include degree designator (d) if it is the trailing component.
00328       break;
00329     default:
00330       if (ind != NONE)
00331         s << setw(1 + min(int(ind), 2));
00332       s << setprecision(0) << pieces[0] << char(tolower(dmsindicators_[0]));
00333       switch (trailing) {
00334       case MINUTE:
00335         s << setw(2 + prec + (prec ? 1 : 0)) << setprecision(prec)
00336           << pieces[1] <<  char(tolower(dmsindicators_[1]));
00337         break;
00338       case SECOND:
00339         s << setw(2) << pieces[1] <<  char(tolower(dmsindicators_[1]))
00340           << setw(2 + prec + (prec ? 1 : 0)) << setprecision(prec)
00341           << pieces[2] <<  char(tolower(dmsindicators_[2]));
00342         break;
00343       default:
00344         break;
00345       }
00346     }
00347     if (ind != NONE && ind != AZIMUTH)
00348       s << hemispheres_[(ind == LATITUDE ? 0 : 2) + (sign < 0 ? 0 : 1)];
00349     return s.str();
00350   }
